result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine Hutchins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges and DNA surcharges are to be paid by 4-1-17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.

Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
May not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jermaine Hutchins in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 7 days time served, release for work, AODA treatment, work and school.  IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on probation for a period of 30 months. Court approved participation in the Dosage Probation Pilot Program and probation may be terminated early if the defendant successfully completes the program and all other conditions of probation.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 4/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 4/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-Advance education
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Jermaine Hutchins in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.  Court vacates 9-10-2014 jury trial.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-01-2014 at 08:30 am.
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Jermaine Hutchins in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jermaine Hutchins in court with attorney James E Toran.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense received a CD and would like time to review it.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine Hutchins in court with attorney James E Toran.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Toran has just been hired by the defendant.  Court allows Attorney Toran to substitute in as counsel of record.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine Hutchins in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Nathaniel Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine Hutchins in court WITHTOUT attorney Louis E Epps.  Dennis Murphy for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is unavailable, due to being in jury trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jermaine Hutchins in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Jacob D Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4-14-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
